Sentencas: La2NiO4+delta is characterised as an example for a potential anode material for high-temperature solid oxide electrolyser cells (SOECs).
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: Short-term characterisation is performed from 700 degrees C to 850 degrees C between 0.01 and 1 bar oxygen partial pressure (pO(2)) on asymmetrical cells using Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-delta as the electrolyte.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: Long-term degradation studies over more than 3000 hours are conducted at 800 degrees C and 0.2 bar pO(2) in dry and humid atmospheres with and without a Cr-source placed in close vicinity to the cell.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: The SOEC anode performance is investigated by current-voltage curves combined with impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: Current densities of up to -410 mA
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: cm(-2) are applied in current-voltage measurements and during long-term degradation studies.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: A total increase in anode resistance by 350% is observed over the course of the degradation measurements in an increasingly harsh environment.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: Post-test analyses by SEM/EDX on a polished cross section of the cell show the presence of several contaminants in the electrode structure.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: However, chromium has not been identified by EDX even after prolonged exposure to Cr-sources in humid atmospheres, which is attributed to the anodic polarisation of the electrode.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs

Sentencas: Electrode delamination appears to be the main factor for the strong loss in performance.
Titulo: Evaluation of oxide ceramics as anodes for SOECs
